info.title: Outlook.com
info.description: Outlook.com connector allows you to manage your mail, calendars, and contacts. You can perform various actions such as send mail, schedule meetings, add contacts, etc.

get.description: This operation gets metadata for a calendar.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Select a calendar.

get.description: This operation gets metadata for a contacts folder.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Select a contacts folder.

get.summary: When an upcoming event is starting soon
get.description: This operation triggers a flow when an upcoming calendar event is starting.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the calendar.

parameters.name: lookAheadTimeInMinutes
parameters.description: Time (in minutes) to look ahead for upcoming events.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, create a calendar item that is starting soon.

get.summary: When an upcoming event is starting soon (V2)
get.description: This operation triggers a flow when an upcoming calendar event is starting.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the calendar.

parameters.name: lookAheadTimeInMinutes
parameters.description: Time (in minutes) to look ahead for upcoming events.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, create a calendar item that is starting soon.

get.description: Get calendar view of events.

parameters.name: calendarId
parameters.description: Select a calendar.

parameters.description: The subscription.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Select a calendar.

parameters.name: incomingDays
parameters.description: Number of incoming days in calendar to be tracked.

parameters.name: pastDays
parameters.description: Number of past days in calendar to be tracked.

parameters.name: options

get.summary: When the file picker is open and being browsed
get.description: When the file picker is open and being browsed.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Name of the operation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the previously selected item.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of the previously selected item

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Limit on the number of results to return.

get.description: This operation gets emails from a folder.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: Mail folder to retrieve emails from (default: 'Inbox').

parameters.name: fetchOnlyUnread
parameters.description: Retrieve only unread emails?.

parameters.name: includeAttachments
parameters.description: If set to true, attachments content will also be retrieved along with the email.

parameters.name: searchQuery
parameters.description: Search query (like in the Outlook client) to filter emails.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Number of emails to retrieve (default: 10).

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of emails to skip (default: 0).

post.description: This operation sends an email message.

parameters.name: emailMessage
parameters.description: Email.

get.description: This operation gets emails from a folder.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: Mail folder to retrieve emails from (default: 'Inbox').

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Recipient email addresses separated by semicolons (If any match, the trigger will run).

parameters.name: cc
parameters.description: CC recipient email addresses separated by semicolons (If any match, the trigger will run).

parameters.name: toOrCc
parameters.description: To or CC recipient email addresses separated by semicolons (If any match, the trigger will run).

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Sender email addresses separated by semicolons (If any match, the trigger will run).

parameters.name: importance
parameters.description: Importance of the email (Any, High, Normal, Low).

parameters.name: fetchOnlyWithAttachment
parameters.description: If set to true, only emails with an attachment will be retrieved. Emails without any attachments will be skipped. If set to false, all emails will be retrieved.

parameters.name: subjectFilter
parameters.description: String to look for in the subject line.

parameters.name: fetchOnlyUnread
parameters.description: Retrieve only unread emails?.

parameters.name: fetchOnlyFlagged
parameters.description: Retrieve only flagged emails?.

parameters.name: mailboxAddress
parameters.description: Address of the shared mailbox.

parameters.name: includeAttachments
parameters.description: If set to true, attachments content will also be retrieved along with the email.

parameters.name: searchQuery
parameters.description: Search query to filter emails. How to use '$search' parameter please refer to: https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/office/office-365-api/api/version-2.0/complex-types-for-mail-contacts-calendar#search-requests.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Number of emails to retrieve (default: 10).

post.description: This operation sends an email message.

parameters.name: emailMessage
parameters.description: Email.

get.description: This operation gets an email by id.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Id of the email.

parameters.name: includeAttachments
parameters.description: If set to true, attachments content will also be retrieved along with the email.

parameters.name: internetMessageId
parameters.description: Internet Message Id.

delete.description: This operation deletes an email by id.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Id of the email to delete.

post.description: This operation moves an email to the specified folder.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Id of the email to be moved.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: Mail folder to move the email to.

post.description: This operation flags an email.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Id of the email to be flagged.

post.description: This operation marks an email as having been read.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Id of the email to be marked as read.

post.description: This operation replies to an email.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Id of the email to reply to.

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: Reply comment.

parameters.name: replyAll
parameters.description: Reply to all recipients.

post.description: This operation replies to an email.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Id of the email to reply to.

parameters.name: replyParameters
parameters.description: Details of the email reply.

post.description: This operation replies to an email.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Id of the email to reply to.

parameters.name: replyParameters
parameters.description: Details of the email reply.

get.description: This operation gets an email attachment by id.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Id of the email.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: Id of the attachment to download.

get.description: This operation triggers a flow when a new email arrives. It will skip any email that has a total message size greater than the limit put by your Exchange Admin or 50 MB, whichever is less. It may also skip protected emails and emails with invalid body or attachments.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: Mail folder to check for new emails.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Recipient email addresses separated by semicolons (If any match, the trigger will run).

parameters.name: cc
parameters.description: CC recipient email addresses separated by semicolons (If any match, the trigger will run).

parameters.name: toOrCc
parameters.description: To or CC recipient email addresses separated by semicolons (If any match, the trigger will run).

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Sender email addresses separated by semicolons (If any match, the trigger will run).

parameters.name: importance
parameters.description: Importance of the email (Any, High, Normal, Low).

parameters.name: fetchOnlyWithAttachment
parameters.description: If set to true, only emails with an attachment will be retrieved. Emails without any attachments will be skipped. If set to false, all emails will be retrieved.

parameters.name: includeAttachments
parameters.description: Should the response of the trigger include the attachments content.

parameters.name: subjectFilter
parameters.description: String to look for in the subject line.

parameters.name: x-ms-operation-context
parameters.description: Special header to enable operation simulation.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, send a new email in your inbox.

get.summary: When a new email mentioning me arrives
get.description: This operation triggers a flow when a new email mentioning me arrives. It will skip any email that has a total message size greater than the limit put by your Exchange Admin or 50 MB, whichever is less. It may also skip protected emails and emails with invalid body or attachments.

parameters.name: messageIdToFireOnFirstTriggerRun
parameters.description: Id of message to fire on first trigger run if supplied.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Message Id to Fire on First Trigger Run

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: Mail folder to check for new emails.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Recipient email addresses separated by semicolons (If any match, the trigger will run).

parameters.name: cc
parameters.description: CC recipient email addresses separated by semicolons (If any match, the trigger will run).

parameters.name: toOrCc
parameters.description: To or CC recipient email addresses separated by semicolons (If any match, the trigger will run).

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Sender email addresses separated by semicolons (If any match, the trigger will run).

parameters.name: importance
parameters.description: Importance of the email (Any, High, Normal, Low).

parameters.name: fetchOnlyWithAttachment
parameters.description: If set to true, only emails with an attachment will be retrieved. Emails without any attachments will be skipped. If set to false, all emails will be retrieved.

parameters.name: includeAttachments
parameters.description: Should the response of the trigger include the attachments content.

parameters.name: subjectFilter
parameters.description: String to look for in the subject line.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, send a new email to your inbox which mentions you.

post.description: This operation sends an email with multiple options and waits for the recipient to respond back with one of the options. Please refer to the following link regarding the support of actionable messages in different mail clients: https://docs.microsoft.com/outlook/actionable-messages/#outlook-version-requirements-for-actionable-messages.

parameters.name: optionsEmailSubscription
parameters.description: Subscription request for options email.

post.description: This operation sends an approval email and waits for a response from the recipient. Please refer to the following link regarding the support of actionable messages in different mail clients: https://docs.microsoft.com/outlook/actionable-messages/#outlook-version-requirements-for-actionable-messages.

parameters.name: approvalEmailSubscription
parameters.description: Subscription request for approval email.

delete.description: This operation deletes a subscription of approval email.

parameters.description: Id of subscription to be deleted.

delete.description: This operation deletes a subscription of options email.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of subscription to be deleted.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of subscription to be deleted

ChangeKey.description: This property identifies the version of the event object. Every time the event is changed, ChangeKey changes as well.

DateTimeLastModified.description: The date and time that the event was last modified

End.description: The end time of the event

EndTimeZone.description: This property specifies the time zone of the meeting end time. The value must be as defined in Windows (example: 'Pacific Standard Time').

HasAttachments.description: Set to true if the event has attachments

ICalUId.description: A unique identifier that is shared by all instances of an event across different calendars

Importance.description: The importance of the event: Low, Normal, or High

IsAllDay.description: Set to true if the event lasts all day

IsCancelled.description: Set to true if the event has been canceled

IsOrganizer.description: Set to true if the message sender is also the organizer

Reminder.description: Time in minutes before event start to remind

ResponseRequested.description: Set to true if the sender would like a response when the event is accepted or declined

SeriesMasterId.description: Unique identifier for Series Master event type

Start.description: The start time of the event

StartTimeZone.description: This property specifies the time zone of the meeting start time. The value must be as defined in Windows (example: 'Pacific Standard Time').
